headline: Berkshire Hathaway earnings, February jobs report: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come next week, including earnings results out from Berkshire Hathaway (BRK-B, BRK-A) this weekend, followed by companies like Costco (COST), Target (TGT), Okta (OKTA), and Broadcom (AVGO) throughout the week; the release of February's jobs report on Friday, March 6; and commentary from presidents of regional Federal Reserve banks. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

content.title: Berkshire Hathaway earnings, February jobs report: What to Watch

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Greg Abel’s First Letter Reframes Berkshire Culture Capital Allocation And Valuation
summary: Greg Abel is set to issue his first shareholder letter as CEO of Berkshire Hathaway alongside the upcoming fourth quarter earnings release. This letter follows Warren Buffett's departure and marks a major leadership handover at NYSE:BRK.A. Investors are watching for signals on capital deployment, management style and any organizational shifts under Abel. Berkshire Hathaway, trading as NYSE:BRK.A, enters this transition with a current share price of $757,414.99. Over the past 3 years the...

headline: Berkshire Hathaway Operating Earnings Fell 30% in Fourth Quarter. There Were No Stock Buybacks.
summary: The company bought back none of its own stock in the period, continuing a trend that began in May 2024.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway reports drop in quarterly profit on insurance operations weakness
summary: Berkshire Hathaway, which wrapped up its final year under Warren Buffett’s leadership, reported Saturday that operating earnings for the fourth quarter totaled $10.2 billion, down 29.8% from last year, on weakness from its insurance business.

content.title: Berkshire Hathaway reports drop in quarterly profit on insurance operations weakness
content.summary: Berkshire Hathaway, which wrapped up its final year under Warren Buffett’s leadership, reported Saturday that operating earnings for the fourth quarter totaled $10.2 billion, down 29.8% from last year, on weakness from its insurance business.

thumbnail.caption: Berkshire Vice Chairman Greg Abel speaks with shareholders during the Berkshire Hathaway Inc. annual shareholders' meeting, in Omaha, Nebraska, on May 2, 2025. - Brendan McDermid/Reuters

headline: How Greg Abel’s First Letter to Berkshire Shareholders Is Different
summary: This year’s letter comes in at 18 pages, significantly longer than Buffett’s letters, which tended to run 10-15 pages.

content.summary: This year’s letter comes in at 18 pages, significantly longer than Buffett’s letters, which tended to run 10-15 pages.

headline: Warren Buffett Is ‘A Very Hard Act to Follow,’ Says Berkshire’s New CEO. He Wants to Make Berkshire ‘Even Stronger.’
summary: Warren Buffett's successor Greg Abel wants Berkshire Hathaway investors to know he'll be able to build on the legendary investor’s legacy. But can he convince them?

content.title: Warren Buffett Is ‘A Very Hard Act to Follow,’ Says Berkshire’s New CEO. He Wants to Make Berkshire ‘Even Stronger.’
content.summary: Warren Buffett's successor Greg Abel wants Berkshire Hathaway investors to know he'll be able to build on the legendary investor’s legacy. But can he convince them?
